inclusion.criterion: Between the 12th and 30th week of pregnancy
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Viral load less than 55,000 copies/ml within 30 days of study entry
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: CD4 count greater than 350 cells/ml within 30 days of study entry
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Have not previously taken anti-HIV medications (women who have taken 8 weeks or fewer of zidovudine are still eligible) OR have taken anti-HIV medication but have been off treatment for more than 180 days
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Intend to stop taking anti-HIV medications after pregnancy
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Willing to have her infant tested for HIV
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Parent or guardian willing to provide informed consent, if applicable
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Have access to a participating site and are willing to be followed for the duration of the study
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Active opportunistic infection or severe medical condition within 14 days of study entry
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Chronic diarrhea within 1 month of study entry or unresolved acute diarrhea within 7 days of study entry
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Diabetes mellitus when not pregnant. Participants who have gestational diabetes are not excluded.
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Current alcohol or other substance abuse that, in the opinion of the investigator, may interfere with the study
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Acute hepatitis within 90 days of study entry
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has myasthenia gravis, class IIa. She takes pyridostigmine 60 mg three times a day and still experiences symptoms that interfere with her job.
